description: Ms. codex. Title from title page (fol. 1a). The same title appears in the preamble (fol. 1b, l. 16). 25 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red. European glazed paper with watermark. Worm-eaten (particularly in the inner margin, with loss of text). Date "1050" written in another ink at the end of the text (fol. 10a). Collation: Paper, fol. 10 ; 1¹⁰ ; catchword on the verso of each leaf. Incipit: الحمد لله الدلا اوجد الموجودات على ابدع مثال واحسن منوال ... وبعد فقد نقل عن الامام حجة الاسلام ولي الله تعالي ابو حامد الغزالي Explicit: السمن كلما ازداد فيه نظرا ازداد تحيرا والله تعالى اعلم وصلى الله على سيدنا محمد واله وصحبه وسلم والحمد لله رب العالمين وحسبنا الله ونعم الوكيل
author: Suyūṭī, 1445-1505
abstract: Short treatise on theodicy, discussing Ghazzālī's best of all possible worlds, expressed in his statement "Laysa fī al-imkān abdaʻ mimmā kān". The text is followed on fol. 10b by an excerpt from the Fatwas of Abū al-Faḍl ibn Ḥajar [al-ʻAsqalānī, d. 1449].
extent: 10 leaves: paper ; 216 x 158 (150 x 92) mm. bound to 217 x 160 mm.
title: Tashyīd al-arkān min laysa fī al-imkān abdaʻ mimmā kān
uniform_title: تشييد الاركان من ليس في الامكان ابدع مما كان
provenance: Two ownership statements on fol. 1a, signed ʻAbd al-Ṣamad al-Ḥusaynī, dated 1257? [1841 or 42], and Maḥmūd al-Sūqī? al-Marʻalī?, dated 1330? [1911 or 12]. Acquired by Robert Garrett from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.
contributor: ابن حجر العسقلاني، احمد بن علي
creator: سيوطي
subject: Theodicy—Early works to 1800
binding_note: Dark blue paper on paper pasteboards for upper and lower covers. Cloth spine.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
